DOC.brief_summary: Post-dural puncture headache ( PDPH ) see frequently pregnant woman due stress , dehydration , intra-abdominal pressure , insufficient fluid replacement delivery . Obesity protect PDPH pregnant woman ; increase intra-abdominal fat tissue reduce cerebrospinal fluid leakage increase pressure epidural space . Therefore , study investigate influence body mass index ( BMI ) PDPH elective caesarean section patient 27G spinal needle use .
DOC.brief_title: Body Mass Index Post-dural Puncture Headache
DOC.detailed_description: The study include 420 woman American Society Anesthesiology physical status I-II underwent elective caesarean section spinal anesthesia . The patient BMI le 30 accept normal weight ( Group I ) BMI 30 accept obese ( Group II ) . Dural puncture perform 27G Quincke spinal needle L3-4 L4-5 intervertebral space give 12.5 mg hyperbaric bupivacaine intrathecally . The patient question regard headache low back pain 6 , 12 , 24 , 48 hour procedure , phone call day 3 7 .
DOC.criteria: ( ASA ) physical status III underwent elective caesarean section SA . Women age 1840 year . Who undergo lumbar disc vertebra surgery , chronic low back pain headache , contraindication neuroaxial block , emergency patient .
